text: Buchi Emecheta OBE (21 July 1944, in Yaba, Lagos - 25 January 2017 in London) was a Nigerian writer. Her first novel, In the Ditch, was published in 1972. Her second novel was published in 1974. The novel is set in London, where Emecheta lived when she wrote it. Emecheta's most well known novel is The Joys of Motherhood. ==Personal life== Emecheta married Sylvester Onwordi when she was sixteen. She had two children. In 1962 she moved with her husband to London. There she had three more children. Emecheta died in her sleep at her home in London on 25 January 2017 from complications of a stroke, aged 72.Femi Adesanya, "Nigerian Literary Icon, Buchi Emecheta Has Died", Information Nigeria, 25 January 2017. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:Writers from Lagos Category:Politicians from Lagos
